content: lara s hat by stitchnerd designs yarns approx 77yds/70m of true super bulky yarn check the yardage/m it should be roughly 70yd/m per 100g examples rowan tumble rowan drift colinette point 5 or substitute bulky or aran yarn doubled be sure to check gauge rowan tumble on 10mm us 15 garter stitch cuff if you are doubling your yarn you ll need double the yd/m gauge 8 stitches per 4 /10cm row gauge isn t critical but may affect yarn requirements my gauge was 13 row per 4 /10cm and i used just under one skein of rowan tumble 74yds/68m to make the basic version suggested needle 10mm us 15 - you can knit flat or in the round as you prefer knitting flat use straight needles and seam at the end details in pattern knitting in the round you can work the whole hat on double-pointed needles dpn s or you can start with a short circular needle and then switch to dpn s as the stitch counts reduce abbreviations and stitches used p purl k knit k2tog knit 2 together decreases by one stitch rs right side ws wrong side st s stitch es stockinette knitting in the round = knit all rounds knitting flat = knit rs row purl ws row garter stitch knitting in the round = knit one round purl one round repeat these 2 rounds knitting flat = knit all row © susan ashcroft 2014 - for personal non-commercial use only from russia with wool 2 basic version using one yarn and with a reverse stockinette cuff for this version the entire hat is knitted in stockinette see pg 1 for explanation if needed cast on using cable cast-on 48 stitches if you are knitting in rounds mark the start of the round and be sure not to twist the stitches when you join work in stockinette to 7½ /18 cm then work the crown as follows k4 k2tog x 8 40 sts work 5 row/rounds in stockinette k3 k2tog x 8 32 sts work 3 row/rounds in stockinette k2 k2tog x8 24 sts work 1 row/round in stockinette riverstone mohair held double k1 k2tog x8 16 sts work 1 row/round in stockinette k2tog x 8 8 sts pull the yarn end though the remaining 8 stitches if you knitted flat sew the seam so that the first 5 /13cm is neat on the ws as this is the part you will see when the cuff is turned up variations using two yarns or with a garter stitch cuff or both garter stitch cuff for the hat shown on page 1 i worked the cuff in garter stitch to do this follow the basic version but work the first 5 /13cm in garter stitch and then continue in stockinette note this version may use slightly more yarn which means that one skein might not be enough using two yarns you can also work the cuff with a textured yarn and then work the top
